text: This chapter delves into the nuanced interplay between artificial intelligence (AI) and emotions within the educational landscape of Latin America and the Caribbean. Through a systematic review methodology, this study illuminates the current state of research, highlighting the multifaceted theories, methodologies, and regional considerations shaping this discourse. By focusing on Brazil and Colombia at the university level, with students as the primary unit of analysis, this review sheds light on the diverse approaches involving facial recognition, psychological frameworks, and software integration. Looking ahead, there is optimism for future research endeavors to expand into new disciplines and adopt innovative methodologies, enriching our understanding of AI-emotion dynamics in education.
